short_answer.name: Gurmeet Singh Jolly (aka Shera)
short_answer.is_red_flag: No (not a PEP or sanctions-listed). Moderate reputational risk because of close association with a high-profile celebrity (Salman Khan).
short_answer.summary: Gurmeet Singh Jolly, widely known as Shera, is Salman Khan’s long-time personal bodyguard and head of security. Open-source checks show no sanctions or criminal convictions; primary risks are reputational and relationship-based (high-profile association).

basic_information.occupation: Celebrity bodyguard; proprietor of Tiger Security
basic_information.notable_association: Personal bodyguard and head of security for actor Salman Khan since 1995
sources: Tiger Security / public profiles and media coverage. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

pep_status.details: No evidence he has held a public office or qualifies as a PEP under FATF definitions. (He is a private security professional and a celebrity associate.)

sanctions_watchlists.details: No matches found in open-source checks to OFAC/UN/EU sanctions lists (open-source review). Formal vendor/API screening recommended for compliance-grade clearance.

adverse_media.details: Recent media coverage is personal/biographical (e.g., reports of his father’s death) and profile pieces about his role as Salman Khan’s bodyguard; no credible reports of corruption, money laundering, or serious criminal allegations found in open sources. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

criminal_records.details: No public criminal convictions or enforcement actions discovered in the searches performed.

financial_profile.details: Reports estimate income from security services and Tiger Security operations, but there is no public evidence that he is a high-net-worth individual of the type that by itself raises AML concerns. Treat as private individual with business income.

ubo_and_corporate_linkages.details: Heads Tiger Security (publicly referenced). If his name appears as UBO/beneficiary of any corporate account, treat as a normal UBO check and request corporate documents. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

transactional_red_flags.details: No unusual transaction patterns publicly visible. Any transactional hit in your systems should be investigated and matched on identifiers (DOB, ID, address) before escalation.

risk_assessment_summary.reputational_risk: Medium (association risk because of celebrity client)
risk_assessment_summary.risk_reasoning: He is a high-profile private security professional tied closely to a very public celebrity. That creates reputational exposure if your company is publicly associated with him, but no indication of sanctions, PEP status, or money-laundering activity was found in open sources.

recommendation.onboarding_decision: Proceed with standard CDD; escalate to EDD only if the person appears as a UBO/beneficiary or if transactional activity looks suspicious.
edd_measures_if_needed: Verify government ID (passport / national ID) and DOB
Collect proof of address and business registration for Tiger Security (if relevant)
Run formal sanctions & PEP vendor screening (exact + fuzzy) using identifiers
If an account shows unusual flows, preserve transaction records and escalate to Legal/Compliance
recommendation.monitoring: If onboarded, set normal monitoring rules; consider heightened adverse-media watch while the celebrity association remains public.
